Timely ruling given @CathMurphyTD speech just now at #newsocracy2 conference & how speech in parliament & reporting… https://t.co/0RI7vta9k9
.@CathMurphyTD 'delighted the NUJ are supporting our Bill which we see as a 1st step in addressing these issues.'
.@CathMurphyTD 'democratic importance of a free & open media was writ large. That's why today @SocDems will today launch Media o/ship Bill
.@CathMurphyTD 'eventually other media outlets caught up with @broadsheet_ie in trusting Constitution but not before weekend of confusion'
.@CathMurphyTD 'newsrooms were afraid to trust Art 15:10 of the Constitution when faced with the legal might of a powerful individual'
.@CathMurphyTD 'it highlighted how a powerful individual (no matter who it is) can exert such a chilling effect over our national media'
.@CathMurphyTD 'a speech in the National Parliament in the public interest was effectively removed from the public narrative.'
.@CathMurphyTD 'at the time we were not aware of any element of the subject of any injunction before the courts..how could we be?'
.@CathMurphyTD 'within a matter of hours of my siteserv speech, media outlets (apart from @broadsheet_ie ) had blocked reporting of it'
.@CathMurphyTD "my work on media ownership goes back to my hiring of @amomcnally in 2012.Siteserv coinciding with the issue was coincidence"
